Let me help translate what President Xi said to Trudeau,

'Everything we discussed were leaked to the media, that's not appropriate, not the way sincere diplomacy should work'
The Guardian didn't translate Xi's words on sincerity before Trudeau interrupted. Also I think it's very one-sided to put "Xi interrupts" when it was Trudeau who interrupted first.

What happened was. Canada couldn’t even get a meeting with China officially, unlikely many countries that did. E.g. Australia, France, etc. Instead Trudeau bumped into Xi in the hallway, mumbled a few things. Xi obliged Trudeau to chat casually. Which should’ve been treated appropriately as a gentleman hallway conversation, not a governed discussion. But then Trudeau went to his own press and claimed he victoriously championed many serious issues and concerns to Xi’s face, he did it primarily for domestic political purposes. That’s what Xi meant when he said that’s not how the conversation was conducted. The “leak” wasn’t about national security secrets, it was about a deliberate misuse of a hallway conversation.
Fair play to Xi Jinping, you don’t often see politicians be this straight forward and open with subjects like this.
Most people trying to translate Xi’s words missed the most important part. Xi suggested Trudeau was lying to the media, what he had leaked wasn’t how the discussion actually went.
Trudeau looked like a talk-show guest leaving early.
A true canadian heritage moment.
Xi Jinping's untranslated words: If there is sincerity, we will respect each other and talk to each other, otherwise the result will be hard to say

In fact, Xi's second sentence, "而且我们也不是那样进行的," was translated (by Xi's translator) as "That's not how the way the conversation WAS conducted " (I don't know why the subtitle is different), which really means, "What you told (to the media) is not the reality of the conversation we had that day."
